trans-unit.source: The DirSyncRequestControl class is a directory control that enables the application to search the directory for objects that have changed since a previous state.
The DirSyncRequestControl constructor creates an instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirSyncRequestControl"></xref> class.
The DirSyncRequestControl constructor creates an instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirSyncRequestControl"></xref> class using the specified parameter.
An opaque structure used by the server.
It is updated by the directory during each <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.SearchRequest"></xref>, which enables the control to incrementally read changes from the directory.
The DirSyncRequestControl constructor creates an instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirSyncRequestControl"></xref> class using the specified parameters.
An opaque structure used by the server.
It is updated by the directory during each <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.SearchRequest"></xref>, which enables the control to incrementally read changes from the directory.
Specifies the behavior of the search.
This parameter can be zero or a combination of one or more of the values of <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectorySynchronizationOptions"></xref>.
The DirSyncRequestControl constructor creates an instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirSyncRequestControl"></xref> class using the specified parameters.
An opaque structure used by the server.
It is updated by the directory during each <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.SearchRequest"></xref>, which enables the control to incrementally read changes from the directory.
Specifies the behavior of the search.
This parameter can be zero or a combination of one or more of the values of <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectorySynchronizationOptions"></xref>.
The maximum number of attributes to return.
The default is 1048576.
The AttributeCount property specifies the maximum number of attributes to return.
The default value of this property is 1048576.
The maximum number of attributes to return.
There was an attempt to set a value less than zero.
The Cookie property contains an opaque structure used by the server.
This property is updated by the directory during each <xref:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.SearchRequest>, which enables the control to incrementally read changes from the directory.
An opaque structure used by the server.
The GetValue method returns the data associated with this control.
The data associated with this control.
The Option property specifies the behavior of the search.
This property can be zero or a combination of one or more of the values of <xref:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectorySynchronizationOptions>.
The behavior of the search.
